items.name: Aeroponic Crop Plot
items.description: The Aeroponic Crop Plot is a farming plot for growing Seeds that can later be harvested for Plant Resources once fully grown. Unless the Prospector has the Fresh Is Best talent when deploying a seed into the crop plot, the grown Plant Resource will eventually wither if not harvested.

items.name: Aluminium Ore
items.description: Aluminium Ore is a mid-game Mineral Resource . Prospectors can first utilize aluminium once they reach level 20 and unlock Tier 3 , when it can be crafted into upgraded Weapons like the Recurve Bow and Aluminium Arrow . It is widely used in constructs (for example, Aluminium Beam and Aluminium Door ), and in the late-game it is a vital component of Items like Composite Chest Armor .

items.name: Arctic Explorer Saddle
items.description: The Arctic Explorer Saddle is a saddle for Mounts that has an artic theme. It is available as part of the Creature Comforts DLC and has the same bonuses as the Arctic Riding Saddle .

items.name: Arctic Pelt
items.description: Arctic Pelts are a harvested Resource used to craft Arctic Armor , a significant upgrade over Fur Armor for prospectors adventuring in the Arctic Biomes .
items.crafted_at: Crafted atTextiles BenchAdvanced Textiles BenchElectric Textiles Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Crafted atTextiles BenchAdvanced Textiles BenchElectric Textiles Bench

items.name: Art Deco Candlestick
items.description: The Art Deco Candlestick is an gilded item of significant worth. It can be built with either beeswax or animal fat and takes either as fuel inputs.

items.name: Bearhide Saddle
items.description: The Bearhide Saddle is a saddle for Mounts that has a bear theme. It is available as part of the Creature Comforts DLC and is a cosmetic change to the Basic Riding Saddle that provides +5% Movement Speed.

items.name: Beeswax Wood Halfpieces
items.description: Reinforced wood building pieces can be unlocked in Tier 2 of the Tech Tree . These building pieces are more resistant to damage than their earlier Wood versions with the inclusion of Beeswax

items.name: Beeswax Wood Halfpitches
items.description: Reinforced wood building pieces can be unlocked in Tier 2 of the Tech Tree . These building pieces are more resistant to damage than their earlier Wood versions with the inclusion of Beeswax

items.name: Biofuel Extractor
items.description: The Biofuel Extractor is a deployable device used to extract Exotics from deep vein Exotic Deposits. It requires Biofuel to run. The Biofuel Extractor runs 33% slower than the Electric Extractor , but can be crafted earlier in the Tech Tree .

items.name: Biomore Backpack
items.description: The Biomore Backpack provides six inventory slots, along with 3 active auras where the prospector and nearby allies having increased physical resistance, quicker healing from bacterial, parasitic and poison modifiers, and additional health regeneration. It also has offers buffs for the wearer, reducing the stamina impact from using tools, and providing more health to downed prospectors when revived. An excellent choice for prospectors specializing in rescues.

items.name: Bone
items.description: Bone is a Animal Resource obtained from Fauna . It is also sometimes found when harvesting fish.

items.name: Bone Javelin
items.description: The Bone Javelin is a variant of the Bone Spear that can only be thrown and is an upgrade to the Wood Javelin . Despite it requiring more materials to craft, the increase in damage can mean the difference between winning and losing a fight against Icarus' fauna.

items.name: Bone Lure
items.description: The Bone Lure can be attached to a Fishing Rod or a Basic Fishing Trap / Advanced Fishing Trap to provide an increase to different attributes detailed in the infobox. The capture zone increase is the size of the capture area during the fishing minigame, increasing the success chance of catching a fish. Like all Lures , the Bone Lure degrades with use and will eventually break after ten uses.

items.name: Bone Shield
items.description: The Bone Shield is crafted at the Character Crafting menu with the following resources:

items.name: Bone Sickle
items.description: Used by 'attacking' plants such as shrubs, Reed Flower , Wheat , etc. Sickles significantly increase the yield of plants when harvesting.

items.name: Bramble Bush
items.description: Bramble Bush is produced by harvesting the cultivated variety of Bramble . Bramble can be grown with Seeds either harvested from wild, extracted with the Seed Extractor or using a Bramble Farming Packet from the Workshop .
harvested_from: extracted with the Seed Extractor or using a Bramble Farming Packet from the Workshop

items.name: Brutalist Candlestick
items.description: The Brutalist Candlestick is mode from concrete and either animal fat or beeswax. There are two varieties by selecting R. Fuel is either beeswax or animal fat.

items.name: Calf
items.description: A Calf is an imported domesticated Fauna that is brought down to the planet and raised to maturity primarily to produce Milk .

items.name: Carbon Fiber
items.description: While being a Tier 3 component, Carbon Fiber is only used to make Carbon Arrows , the Carbon Spear / Javelin , and the Carbon Fibre Round Shield in the Tier 3 Tech Tree; however, it is a critical component widely used in Tier 4 crafting.

items.name: Carrot
items.description: Carrots are a common form of Plantlife found in the Forest and Riverlands locations on Icarus. When consumed by prospectors, they replenish Hunger .

items.name: Carved Wood 2-Seater Couch
items.description: The Carved Wood 2-Seater Couch is a decorative item.

items.name: Carved Wood 3-Seater Couch
items.description: The Carved Wood 3-Seater Couch is a decorative item.

items.name: Carved Wood Bookshelf
items.description: The Carved Wood Bookshelf is a decorative item.

items.name: Carved Wood Cabinet
items.description: The Carved Wood Cabinet is a decorative piece with 10 item slots.

items.name: Carved Wood Candlestick
items.description: The Carved Wood Candlestick can be crafted using either beeswax or animal fat and will take either as fuel. There are three varieties that can be selected using the 'R' key while deploying.

items.name: Carved Wood Desk Lamp
items.description: The Carved Wood Desk Lamp is a decorative item that requires 150 kwh of electricity

items.name: Carved Wood Dresser
items.description: The Carved Wood Dresser is a decorative item with 10 inventory slots.

items.name: Carved Wood Nightstand
items.description: The Carved Wood Nightstand is a decorative nightstand with 10 inventory slots. It has five build variants available by using the 'R' key when deploying.

items.name: Carved Wood Stool
items.description: The Carved Wood Stool is a decorative item.

items.name: Carved Wood Wardrobe
items.description: The Carved Wood Wardrobe is a decorative wardrobe with 10 inventory slots. It has two build variants available by selecting 'R' when deploying.

items.name: Chicken
items.description: A Chicken is a Transplanted farm animal that provides a source of Eggs and Raw Chicken for Food recipes.

items.name: Coal Ore
items.description: Coal Ore is a Mineral found on Icarus in the open and caves. It's most basic use is as a fuel in a Campfire or Stone Furnace , though this is somewhat inefficient as it is more valuable as component for crafting.

items.name: Cocoa Seed
items.description: Cocoa Seed are a common form of Plantlife found in the Forest and Riverlands locations on Icarus.

items.name: Coconut Farming Packet
items.description: The Coconut Farming Packet is unlocked in the Workshop on the Space Station or the Orbital Exchange Interface and is equipped in the Prospectors loadout before starting a new prospect. Only after landing on Icarus can the packet be consumed, giving the Prospector five seeds that can be planted in Dirt Mounds or Crop Plots .

items.name: Coffee Bean
items.description: Coffee Bean are a common form of Plantlife found in the Forest and Riverlands locations on Icarus.

items.name: Coffee Smoked Fatty T-bone
items.description: Coffee Smoked Fatty T-bone is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

items.name: Cold Steel Sickle
items.description: Cold Steel Sickle is a Tier 3 Sickle made with Cold Steel Ingots introduced on Prometheus . Due to the materials required, crafting the item requires the New Frontiers DLC.

items.name: Copper Ore
items.description: Copper Ore is an early-game Mineral Resource . It is widely used in the construction of Interior Wood Building Pieces , and prospectors can make extensive use of copper once they reach level 20 and unlock Tier 3 , as it is a crucial component in Electronics . In the late game, copper is used in various deployables like the Refrigerator and the Material Processor .

items.name: Corn
items.description: Corn are a common form of Plantlife found in the Forest and Riverlands locations on Icarus. When consumed by prospectors, they replenish Hunger .

items.name: Cow
items.description: A Cow is the mature version of a Calf that can be purchased and brought down to the planet primarily to produce Milk .

items.name: Crushed Bone
items.description: Useful alternate resource for making Epoxy .

items.name: Cryogenically Frozen Calf
items.description: The Cryogenically Frozen Calf is a deployable container containing a Calf that can be researched and obtained in the Workshop and called down to the planet using the Orbital Exchange Interface .

items.name: Cryogenically Frozen Chicken
items.description: The Cryogenically Frozen Chicken is a deployable container containing a Chicken that can be researched and obtained in the Workshop and called down to the planet using the Orbital Exchange Interface .

items.name: Cultivar Backpack
items.description: The Cultivar Backpack is a wearable Farming -focused backpack that provides six inventory slots, increased yield of harvested Plant Resources , harvesting of Seeds and exposure resistance.

items.name: Dried Fatty T-Bone
items.description: Dried Fatty T-Bone is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

items.name: Exotics
items.description: Exotics are one the most valuable Mineral harvested on Icarus and are a potential reward for completing certain Missions / Operations . They were the reason terraforming failed on Icarus, and now their unique properties are sought after by the various Factions seeking to exploit Icarus.
harvested_from: any mission except Potshot: Training; the yield per vein
where they are located vary per mission

items.name: Fiber
items.description: Fiber is a basic resource collected from plants, trees and bushes and is used for crafting many different recipes or burning as a fuel source. It is an essential ingredient for the early game and often one of the first items to be harvested when landing on Icarus.

items.name: Fiber Farming Packet
items.description: The Fiber Farming Packet is unlocked in the Workshop on the Space Station and is equipped in the Prospectors loadout before starting a new prospect. Only after landing on Icarus can the packet be consumed, giving the Prospector five Fiber seeds, which then can be planted in Dirt Mounds or Crop plots to grow Plant Resources .

items.name: Fiber Lure
items.description: The Fiber Lure can be attached to a Fishing Rod or a Basic Fishing Trap / Advanced Fishing Trap to provide an increase to different attributes detailed in the infobox. The capture zone increase is the size of the capture area during the fishing minigame, increasing the success chance of catching a fish. Like all Lures , the Fiber Lure degrades with use and will eventually break after ten uses.

items.name: Frozen Ore
items.description: Frozen Ore is a resource produced as a by-product of mining a mineral node with a Pickaxe that has a chance to produce frozen ore, such as the Cold Steel Pickaxe or Inaris "Viridian" Pickaxe .

items.name: Fur
items.description: Fur is widely used when crafting Armors , and in certain Deployables like the Bedroll . It is a crucial ingredient in Fur Armor , which is essential equipment for prospectors venturing into the Arctic Biome for the first time.

items.name: Gold Ore
items.description: Gold Ore is a Mineral Resource . Prospectors can make extensive use of Gold Ore once they reach level 20 and unlock Tier 3 , as it is a crucial component in Electronics .

items.name: Gold Ore Lure
items.description: The Gold Ore Lure can be attached to a Fishing Rod or a Basic Fishing Trap / Advanced Fishing Trap to provide an increase to different attributes detailed in the infobox. The capture zone size increase widens the size of the capture area during the fishing minigame, increasing the success chance of catching a fish. Like all Lures , the Gold Ore Lure degrades with use and will eventually break after ten uses.

items.name: Gorse Flower
items.description: Gorse Flower are a common form of Plantlife found in the Forest and Riverlands locations on Icarus.

items.name: Hydroponic Crop Plot
items.description: The Hydroponic Crop Plot is a farming plot for growing Seeds that can later be harvested for Plant Resources once fully grown. Unless the Prospector has the Fresh Is Best talent when deploying a seed into the crop plot, the grown Plant Resource will eventually wither if not harvested.

items.name: Ice Borer
items.description: The Ice Borer will drill super-cooled ice deposits when supplied with biofuel from a Biofuel Can / MXC Fuel Canister . Super-cooled ice deposits can only be found on frozen lakes and rivers in the Arctic regions of Prometheus (Biomes: Glacial Cascade or Alpine Steppe - a map of Prometheus biomes can be found here .). The Ice Borer has 5 slots and will last 2 hours and 5 minutes on a full Biofuel Can .

items.name: Industrial Candlestick
items.description: The Industrial Candlestick is a decorative item from the Industrial Furniture Pack DLC.

items.name: Interior Wood Cupboard
items.description: The Interior Wood Cupboard is a deployable floor-standing storage cabinet made of Refined Wood .

items.name: Interior Wood Halfpieces
items.description: Interior Wood Building Pieces bring a clean appealing aesthetic to any base, although usually rather weak to weather, and quite flammable. Can be repaired with a Repair Hammer .

items.name: Interior Wood Halfpitches
items.description: Interior Wood Building Pieces bring a clean appealing aesthetic to any base, although usually rather weak to weather, and quite flammable. Can be repaired with a Repair Hammer .

items.name: Interior Wood Ladder
items.description: Interior Wood Building Pieces bring a clean appealing aesthetic to any base, although usually rather weak to weather, and quite flammable. Can be repaired with a Repair Hammer .

items.name: Interior Wood Railing
items.description: Interior Wood Building Pieces bring a clean appealing aesthetic to any base, although usually rather weak to weather, and quite flammable. Can be repaired with a Repair Hammer .

items.name: Interior Wood Railing Gate
items.description: Interior Wood Building Pieces bring a clean appealing aesthetic to any base, although usually rather weak to weather, and quite flammable. Can be repaired with a Repair Hammer .

items.name: Iron Crop Plot
items.description: The Iron Crop Plot is a farming plot for growing Seeds that can later be harvested for Plant Resources once fully grown. Unless the Prospector has the Fresh Is Best talent when deploying a seed into the crop plot, the grown Plant Resource will eventually wither if not harvested.

items.name: Iron Ore
items.description: Iron Ore is a Mineral , that allows prospectors to create Tier 2 / Tier 3 Tools and Weapons with both the Anvil Bench and Machining Bench . In addition, iron is widely used in Steel Ingot for crafting Items such as the Steel Pickaxe , and Late-game Deployables like the Fabricator / Electric Furnace .

items.name: Leather
items.description: Leather is a crucial component of many recipes in Icarus. Having a good stockpile of leather is something every prospector strive for.

items.name: Legendary Biomass
items.description: Legendary Biomass is an in-game currency used to craft attachments to upgrade Legendary Weapons at the Bio-lab in orbit.

items.name: Lily
items.description: A small flower which grows in groups in the Forest Biome on Icarus. They can be harvested most efficiently with the use of Sickles .

items.name: Mature Coconut
items.description: If a prospector lets a Ripe Coconut decay, it will ripen into a mature coconut.

items.name: Medium Interior Wood Crate
items.description: A Medium Interior Wood Crate made of refined wood and copper nails. Similar size to the Medium Wood Crate .

items.name: Medium Wood Crate
items.description: Larger than the Small Wood Crate , the Medium Wood Crate also possesses an increased inventory space with 20 slots. Like most other Deployables , this must be under Shelter or it will be destroyed when exposed to Weather events. It is possible to loot the contents if this crate is destroyed, but only for a limited time.

items.name: Medium Wood Hedgehog
items.description: The Medium Wood Hedgehog are sturdy defenses used around your base or while at objectives for protection of equipment.

items.name: Miasmic Javelin
items.description: The Miasmic Javelin is a variant of the Miasmic Spear that can only be thrown. Deals poison damage on hit and has a 15% chance to apply a unique debuff to targets while dealing periodic poison damage. Excels when used against Fauna that have a weakness to poison. A list of Fauna that are weak to poison can be viewed here . When the Miasma modifier does proc, periodic poison damage is dealt to the target over the span of 10 seconds. Fauna with:

items.name: Miasmic Sickle
items.description: Miasmic Sickle is a Tier 4 Sickle made with Distilled Miasmic Coating derived from Crystallized Miasma found in the Swamps on Prometheus . Due to the materials required, crafting the item requires the New Frontiers DLC.

items.name: Milk
items.description: Milk is a late-game resource obtained from mature Cows raised from juvenile Calves purchased from the orbital Workshop . Calves must be raised to adulthood using similar mechanics to taming Mounts including feeding, watering and providing a bed for the animal to sleep on.

items.name: Mining Armature
items.description: The Mining Armature is an electro-mechanical gauntlet that serves as a Pickaxe for mining or for use in melee combat where it can inflict considerable damage to armored targets. It can be purchased in the Bio-lab and upgraded with various attachments.

items.name: Mushroom
items.description: Mushrooms can only be harvested in caves in the Arctic biomes, and are harvested by hand. Caves with Mushrooms are almost exclusively caves with pit traps, this can make them easier to find on interactive maps. Also the Mushroom Farming Packet can be purchased in the Workshop . Consuming this item will yield 5 Mushrooms.

items.name: NOREX Boss Tracker Upgrade
items.description: The NOREX Boss Tracker Upgrade is an upgrade for the CONT4CT Device deployed in an Open World map that visually upgrades the screens and provides a Bosses tab that provides information on the currently active world bosses.

items.name: Noxious Logging Inhaler
items.description: The Noxious Logging Inhaler is a Medicine that allows Infected Bark to be harvested when chopping trees and also boosts felling damage and resistance to collision damage from falling trees.

items.name: Noxious Mining Inhaler
items.description: The Noxious Mining Inhaler is a Medicine whose effects allow Noxious Crust to be harvested when mining and add a small boost to mining yield and radius.

items.name: Packed Fuel Brick
items.description: Packed Fuel Brick is a crafted form of fuel used for Campfires , Floor Torches or other places requiring combustible fuel.
harvested_from: although it first requires coconut Seeds

items.name: Platinum Ore
items.description: Platinum Ore is a mid-game Mineral Resource , and can be utilized by prospectors after they reach level 20 and unlock Tier 3 in the Tech Tree . Platinum is required for a number of upgraded Tools and Weapons , including the Platinum Spear and Platinum Sickle .

items.name: Platinum Weave
items.description: Platinum Weave is a Tier 3  crafted resource used for various items including armor, animal items, rugs, fishing lures and furniture.
items.crafted_at: Advanced Textiles Bench Electric Textiles Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Advanced Textiles Bench Electric Textiles Bench

items.name: Poison Sack
items.description: Poison Sacks are a resource that drops from Caveworms . Only after completing Unearthed: Research can these sacks and Caveworm Scales be used to craft new weaponry at a Crafting Bench .
harvested_from:
le with care



Harvesting Information

Source
Caveworms


Location
Caves



Misc Info




Weight
Stack Size




1

items.name: Potato
items.description: A plant which grows in the Swamp and Tundra Biomes on Prometheus. They can be harvested most efficiently with the use of Sickles .

items.name: Prototype Thumper
items.description: The more ore available, the bigger the impact on the surrounding environment, so expect more opposition when taking on lucrative deposits in densely populated areas.

items.name: Pumpkin
items.description: Pumpkin are a common form of Plantlife found in the Forest and Riverlands locations on Icarus. When consumed by prospectors, they replenish Hunger .

items.name: Reed Flower
items.description: Reed flowers can be found alongside water in the Forest Biome on Icarus. They can be harvested most efficiently with a Sickle .

items.name: Resources
items.description: Prospectors face a host of challenges when they drop onto Icarus. They must maintain an adequate supply of Oxygen , Water and Food , craft Shelter from the planets storms, and survive encounters with the Fauna . Prospectors will need to rely on a wide range of resources: some they will find in the wild, and others they will make themselves. How prospectors master the use of these resources will determine their overall success during their limited time on Icarus.

items.name: Sandworm
items.description: A monstrous beast that lives beneath the sand on Olympus and Styx .

items.name: Sandworm Scale
items.description: Harvested from Sandworms , attacking the body of a Sandworm will break off scales which fall to the ground. However, be quick about retrieval as these scales are lost to the dunes quickly.
harvested_from: attacking the body of a S
worm will break off scales which fall to the ground

items.name: Scorpion Carapace
items.description: Scorpion Carapace is required for Scorpion Armor , a set with one of the highest physical resistances in the game. Must complete Husk: Extermination to unlock the recipe for this resource to be useful.

items.name: Seeds
items.description: Seeds are a resource harvested from Flora or produced in a Seed Extractor that can be planted in Dirt Mounds or Crop Plots to produce more of that specific crop.
harvested_from: Flora or produced in a Seed Extractor that can be planted in Dirt Mounds or Crop Plots to produce more of that specific crop

items.name: Sheep
items.description: A sheep preserved in cryogenic stasis that can be deployed and defrosted on a planet.

items.name: Silica Ore
items.description: Silica Ore is a Mineral found on the surface of Icarus. Prospectors are likely to first use silica to create the Mortar and Pestle . However, it is also the key in making glass and concrete.

items.name: Sinotai Dropship Recall Beacon
items.description: The Sinotai Dropship Recall Beacon will fire a flare that calls the Prospectors dropship to that location when thrown, which can either be used for immediate extraction or left there for use later on. Multiple Recall Beacons can be used per session, however, these are one-use items, so use them carefully. Items stored in the dropships inventory will not be lost when the dropship is called, allowing Prospectors to transport equipment/resources over large distances.

items.name: Small Interior Wood Crate
items.description: A Small Interior Wood Crate made of refined wood and copper nails. Similar size to the Small Wood Crate .

items.name: Small Interior Wood Cupboard
items.description: The Small Interior Wood Cupboard is a deployable wall-mounted storage cabinet made of Refined Wood .

items.name: Small Stone Sign
items.description: The Small Stone Sign is a deployable sign post available as a wall sign, floor sign or a small angled variant.
items.crafted_at: Crafted AtMasonry BenchAdvanced Masonry BenchElectric Masonry Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Crafted AtMasonry BenchAdvanced Masonry BenchElectric Masonry Bench

items.name: Small Tree
items.description: A small, immature tree, most often growing in wooded areas of the Forest Biome on Icarus. Can be harvested by hand for Sticks and Fiber , but more efficiently with an Axe .

items.name: Small Wood Crate
items.description: The Small Wood Crate is the first available storage container that can be made by the prospector. While limited in inventory space, anything here will not be lost upon the death of the prospector or count against inventory weight. Like most other Deployables , this must be under Shelter or it will be destroyed when exposed to Weather events. It is possible to loot the contents if this crate is destroyed, but only for a limited time.

items.name: Small Wood Cupboard
items.description: The Small Wood Cupboard is a small deployable wooden cabinet for Storage that can be mounted on a wall.
items.crafted_at: Crafted AtCrafting BenchCarpentry BenchElectric Carpentry BenchMachining BenchFabricator

base_recipe.crafted_at: Crafted AtCrafting BenchCarpentry BenchElectric Carpentry BenchMachining BenchFabricator

items.name: Small Wood Sign
items.description: A Small Wood Sign made of Refined Wood and Copper Nails .

items.name: Soy Bean
items.description: Soy Beans are a common form of Plantlife found in the Forest and Riverlands locations on Icarus.

items.name: Spider Silk
items.description: Spider Silk is a Animal Resource harvested from Spiders .

items.name: Sponge
items.description: Sponges are found growing in bodies of water on Icarus and are gathered by hand. Sponges are also be obtained through the use of Water Wheels and Basic Fishing Traps / Advanced Fishing Traps . Sponges can be identified with this reference image:

items.name: Squash
items.description: Squash are a common form of Plantlife found in the Desert locations on Icarus. When consumed by prospectors, they replenish Hunger .

items.name: Stick
items.description: Sticks are harvested by picking them up off of the ground, or when harvesting small trees and saplings. Sticks can also be crafted from wood at the Carpentry Bench , or in the Character Crafting menu if you have the Wood Breakdown talent (and its matching Blueprint in Tier 1).

items.name: Stone
items.description: Stone is one of the most abundant Minerals available on Icarus. Prospectors will make extensive use of stone from the moment they exit their drop-pods, as it is widely used in the early game for both Tools and Weapons .

items.name: Stone Brick
items.description: Stone Bricks are a refined resource primarily used to craft Stone Brick Building Pieces at an Advanced Masonry Bench / Electric Masonry Bench .
items.crafted_at: Advanced Masonry Bench Electric Masonry Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Advanced Masonry Bench Electric Masonry Bench

items.name: Stone Brick Fireplace
items.description: The Stone Brick Fireplace is deployable Stone Brick version of the Fireplace that provides a source of heat, a source of light , Coziness and a means to cook Food indoors at an accelerated pace.
items.crafted_at: Advanced Masonry Bench Electric Masonry Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Advanced Masonry Bench Electric Masonry Bench

items.name: Stone Brick Fireplace Cap
items.description: A Stone Brick Fireplace Cap is the final cap piece to place on a Stone Brick Fireplace Extension or directly on a Stone Brick Fireplace . Two variants, a half height and full height, are available by holding the 'R' key when deploying.
items.crafted_at: Advanced Masonry Bench Electric Masonry Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Advanced Masonry Bench Electric Masonry Bench

items.name: Stone Brick Fireplace Extension
items.description: A Stone Brick Fireplace Extension is a hollow rectangular tower of Stone Brick masonry that forms a chimney to place on a Stone Brick Fireplace or another existing Stone Brick Fireplace Extension to extend the chimney vertically. It is usually capped with a Stone Brick Fireplace Cap .
items.crafted_at: Advanced Masonry Bench Electric Masonry Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Advanced Masonry Bench Electric Masonry Bench

items.name: Stone Brick Halfpieces
items.description: Stone Brick pieces offer +10 Insulation from Temperature, +100% Falling Tree Resistance and +65% Wind Resistance.

items.name: Stone Brick Halfpitches
items.description: Stone Brick pieces offer +10 Insulation from Temperature, +100% Falling Tree Resistance and +65% Wind Resistance.

items.name: Stone Buffalo Statue
items.description: The Stone Buffalo Statue is a decorative stone item.

items.name: Stone Cairn
items.description: Stone Cairns are a deployable item can be used as waystones to mark a path across the landscape or to mark areas of significance. Stone Cairns also have one inventory slot that can be used to store deceased pets, marking their grave and providing them a small memorial. When inspecting the Stone Cairn by pressing F, the name and description can be changed as needed.

items.name: Stone Caveworm Statue
items.description: The Stone Caveworm Statue is a decorative stone item.

items.name: Stone Deer Statue
items.description: The Stone Deer Statue is a decorative stone item.

items.name: Stone Elephant Statue
items.description: The Stone Elephant Statue is a decorative stone item.

items.name: Stone Frame
items.description: Stronger than Wood, and resistant to weather, Stone Buildings are a game changer when it comes to surviving on Icarus.
items.crafted_at: the Masonry Bench with the following resources:

base_recipe.crafted_at: the Masonry Bench with the following resources:

items.name: Stone Halfpieces
items.description: Stronger than Wood, and resistant to weather, Stone Buildings are a game changer when it comes to surviving on Icarus.
items.crafted_at: the Masonry Bench with the following resources:

base_recipe.crafted_at: the Masonry Bench with the following resources:

items.name: Stone Halfpitches
items.description: Stronger than Wood, and resistant to weather, Stone Buildings are a game changer when it comes to surviving on Icarus.
items.crafted_at: the Masonry Bench with the following resources:

base_recipe.crafted_at: the Masonry Bench with the following resources:

items.name: Stone Komodo Statue
items.description: The Stone Komodo Statue is a decorative stone item.

items.name: Stone Pile
items.description: The Stone Pile, alongside the Wood Pile , are makeshift storage options for large quantities of each raw material. The Stone Pile is immune to ALL Weather damage and can be used as a durable barrier to Fauna , especially against Fauna like the Grizzly Bear . If placed with just a narrow opening between piles, Bears have an incredibly difficult time getting through which allows the Prospector to melee attack just beyond the bear's attack range.

items.name: Stone Piranha Statue
items.description: The Stone Piranha Statue is a decorative stone item.

items.name: Stone Rabbit Statue
items.description: The Stone Rabbit Statue is a decorative stone item.

items.name: Stone Water Trough
items.description: The Stone Water Trough is a decorative upgrade to the Water Trough that allows multiple creatures to drink from it simultaneously and can be connected to Water using a Water Pipe Tool , similar to the Large Water Trough . The Stone Water Trough can only store water and cannot provide water to the rest of the network like Water Barrels or Metal Rain Reservoirs .

items.name: Stonejaw Trophy
items.description: Stonejaw Trophies are decorative deployables that can be placed on any wall surface and are used to liven any living space. Aside from helping prospectors complete the Bestiary , it can also be used in tandem with other Furniture to increase the Coziness of your living quarters, increasing the duration and effectiveness of the Well Rested Buff .

items.name: Talents
items.description: With 465 combined talents to choose from, Icarus' talent trees give prospectors the ability to construct their own unique play-styles inside of five primary Categories: Survival, Adventure, Habitation, Combat and Solo Talents Trees.

items.name: Tea
items.description: Tea are a common form of Plantlife found in the Forest and Riverlands locations on Icarus.

items.name: Threshing Attachment
items.description: Threshing Attachment is a mid game item available once the prospector has unlocked the Tool Attachment Pack tech.

items.name: Titanium Ore
items.description: Titanium Ore is a late-game Mineral, and can be utilized by prospectors after they reach level 30 and unlock the Fabricator in the Tier 4 Tech Tree . Titanium represents the current pinnacle of material strength for Tools and for several Weapons .

items.name: Tomato
items.description: Tomato are a fruit found growing on bushes in the Grassland Biome on Icarus. They can be harvested by hand or more efficiently with the use of a Sickle .
harvested_from: area or grown in Crop Plots or Dirt Mounds by planting Seeds obtained by harvesting or from purchasing a Tomato Farming Packet

items.name: UDA Aluminium Ore Resource Supply
items.description: Despite the usefulness of these supply packs, they are quite expensive when used often (ideal for creative builds). Don't feel like running out to gather materials, and you're out of Ren? Exotics can be sold for Ren under the Workshop tab while at the station, and Ren can be obtained by completing SMPL3 missions using the Short Range Radio .

items.name: UDA Wood Resource Supply
items.description: Despite the usefulness of these supply packs, they are quite expensive when used often (ideal for creative builds). Don't feel like running out to gather materials, and you're out of Ren? Exotics can be sold for Ren under the Workshop tab while at the station, and Ren can be obtained by completing SMPL3 missions using the Short Range Radio .

items.name: Vapor Condenser
items.description: The Vapor Condenser is a deployable that can be placed on Enzyme Geysers to extract Condensed Enzymes , Volatile Raw Exotics and Exotics . The amount of rewards depends on the map (Outpost or not), the area and the difficulty setting.

items.name: Volatile Exotic Seed
items.description: Volatile Exotic Seeds are a resource obtained from Strange Plants that can be planted in Dirt Mounds or Crop Plots to produce more Volatile Raw Exotics .

items.name: Water Borer
items.description: The Water Borer is a device that can be placed on Enzyme Geysers and when powered, can be used to extract Water which can be fed into a water network.

items.name: Watermelon
items.description: Watermelons are a common form of Plantlife found in the Forest and Riverlands locations on Icarus. When consumed by Prospectors, they replenish Hunger and Thirst .

items.name: Wheat
items.description: A tall grass which grows in clusters in the Forest Biome on Icarus. They can be harvested most efficiently with the use of Sickles . Can be processed into flour using the Mortar and Pestle .

items.name: Wood
items.description: Wood is a basic crafting ingredient obtained from Trees using an axe or harvested by hand in the Desert via Cacti. Wood can also be used as a Fuel source for Campfire , Fireplace , and Stone Furnace .

items.name: Wood Buffalo Statue
items.description: The Wood Buffalo Statue is a decorative wood item.

items.name: Wood Burner
items.description: The Wood Burner is a source of heat and basic cooking similar to a Campfire or Fireplace . It provides the Warming Fire effect (heat and +100% Perceived Threat) allowing a Prospector to sleep nearby. Once fuel is added, it can be activated and will consume fuel regardless of any selected recipe.

items.name: Wood Composter
items.description: Wood Composter increases the rate at which food spoils, and will turn Spoiled Plants or Guano into Basic Fertilizer .

items.name: Wood Crop Plot
items.description: The Wood Crop Plot is a farming plot for growing Seeds that can later be harvested for Plant Resources once fully grown. Unless the Prospector has the Fresh Is Best talent when deploying a seed into the crop plot, the grown Plant Resource will eventually wither if not harvested.

items.name: Wood Cupboard
items.description: Taking up the same floor-space but with a much larger inventory, this is a great upgrade from the Medium Wood Crate .
items.crafted_at: Crafted AtCrafting BenchCarpentry BenchElectric Carpentry BenchMachining BenchFabricator

base_recipe.crafted_at: Crafted AtCrafting BenchCarpentry BenchElectric Carpentry BenchMachining BenchFabricator

items.name: Wood Deer Statue
items.description: The Wood Deer Statue is a decorative wood item.

items.name: Wood Gate Fortification
items.description: The Wood Gate Fortification serves as an entrance when using Wood Wall Fortifications . Similar to Medium Wood Hedgehogs , the Wood Gate Fortification does not take damage during storms. Wood Spikes Fortification cannot be mounted to the Wood Gate Fortification.

items.name: Wood Halfpieces
items.description: Stronger than Thatch, wood buildings are a good starting point for prospectors wanting to establish a 'Main Base'. While still flammable they are able to fully withstand most light storms and offer good protection to Deployables and Storage containers. Wood roofs or walls require a floor or wall structure such as Wood Wall for snapping. Hold 'R' while placing the Wood Halfpieces itself to determine shape as well as placement as roof, or wall.

items.name: Wood Halfpitches
items.description: Stronger than Thatch, wood buildings are a good starting point for prospectors wanting to establish a 'Main Base'. While still flammable they are able to fully withstand most light storms and offer good protection to Deployables and Storage containers. Wood roofs or walls require a floor or wall structure such as Wood Wall for snapping. Hold 'R' while placing the Wood Halfpitches itself to determine shape as well as placement as roof, or wall.

items.name: Wood Javelin
items.description: The Wood Javelin is a variant of the Wood Spear that can only be thrown. The Wood Javelin has the slowest projectile travel time and highest projectile fall-off, but that can be overlooked by it's cheap producibility.

items.name: Wood Ladder
items.description: Stronger than Thatch, wood buildings are a good starting point for Prospectors wanting to establish a 'Main Base'. While still flammable, they are able to fully withstand most light storms and offer good protection to Deployables and Storage containers. Wood Ladders can be use with Trapdoor holes (hold R while holding a floor building piece and select the Trapdoor variant from the radial wheel). Does not snap to trapdoor holes.

items.name: Wood Pile
items.description: The Wood Pile, alongside the Stone Pile , are makeshift storage options for large quantities of each raw material. Though immune to most Weather damage, beware of lightning strikes. Can be used as a durable barrier to Fauna , especially against Fauna like the Grizzly Bear , although the stone variant is preferred.

items.name: Wood Piranha Statue
items.description: The Wood Piranha Statue is a decorative wood item.

items.name: Wood Rabbit Statue
items.description: The Wood Rabbit Statue is a decorative wood item.

items.name: Wood Railing
items.description: The Wood Railing is part of the Wood Building Trim Set , which is learned in the Tier 1 Tech Tree after unlocking the Wood Building Base Set .

items.name: Wood Railing Gate
items.description: Stronger than Thatch, wood buildings are a good starting point for Prospectors wanting to establish a 'Main Base'. While still flammable, they are able to fully withstand most light storms and offers good protection to Deployables and Storage containers. Wood Railing Gates can be deployed on their own or can be snapped to railings/floors.

items.name: Wood Shield
items.description: The Wood Shield is crafted at the Anvil, Forge, or Foundry with the following resources:

items.name: Wood Spikes Fortification
items.description: The Wood Spikes Fortification serves as large hedgehog that can attach Wood Wall Fortifications to fend off the predators of Icarus. Similar to Medium Wood Hedgehogs , the Wood Spikes Fortification does not take damage during storms.

items.name: Wood Walkway Fortification
items.description: The Wood Walkway Fortification is attached to Wood Wall Fortifications and serves as a platform that Prospectors can stand on, providing them a vantage point to see over their walls. Similar to Medium Wood Hedgehogs , the Wood Walkway Fortification does not take damage during storms.

items.name: Wooden Lure
items.description: The Wooden Lure can be attached to a Fishing Rod or a Basic Fishing Trap / Advanced Fishing Trap to provide an increase to different attributes detailed in the infobox. Like all Lures , the Wooden Lure degrades with use and will eventually break after ten uses.

items.name: Wooden Shovel
items.description: The Wooden Shovel is an early-game Tool used to create Dirt Mounds (right-click), harvest Ice / Dirt / Sand (left-click), or remove ash/snow buildup on structures in the Arctic / Volcanic biomes on Icarus.

items.name: Wool
items.description: Wool from sheep can be used to craft arctic pelt, platinum weave or rope.

items.name: Yeast
items.description: A small flower which grows in groups in the Forest Biome on Icarus. They can be harvested most efficiently with the use of Sickles .

items.name: Young Coconut
items.description: Harvested from palm trees in the Desert , when chopping their tops with an axe. If a prospector lets it decay, it will ripen into a Ripe Coconut .
harvested_from: when chopping their tops with an axe
